text.p: -- Merrill Lynch said analyst Bruce Smith downgraded Netscape Communications Corp to near-term neutral from accumulate, and to long-term neutral from buy.
-- Smith said in a research report that Netscape's recent product introductions are "sound first steps, but much more is needed to compete in the long run."
-- said company has made "very little progress on major strategic alliances."

-- said "recent conversations with industry sources indicate that Netscape is not inclined to enter into the kinds of partnerships that we believe would improve its competitive position versus Microsoft Corp."
-- Smith believes he has "underestimated Microsoft, and the window of opportunity for Netscape to partner is closing much more rapidly than we originally thought."
-- Netscape's third-quarter results "appear on track, and we are comfortable with our estimate of $85.6 million in revenues and net income of $6.8 million, or $0.08 per share.
